emerging_technologies.name: Automated Software Development (ASD)
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems that can autonomously develop software from high-level requirements, reducing human effort in coding.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Significant reduction in coding jobs; potential increase in software productivity; ethical considerations around AI-generated code.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High demand for faster software development, resistance from traditional developers, regulatory concerns about AI authorship.

emerging_technologies.name: Neuro-Implantable Interfaces
emerging_technologies.description: Implantable devices for direct brain-computer interfaces, allowing thought control of machines and cognitive enhancement.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Ethical concerns about privacy, identity, and cognitive equity; potential to revolutionize treatment for neurological disorders.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Need for extensive testing for safety and efficacy, regulatory hurdles, societal acceptance of invasive procedures.

emerging_technologies.name: Space Habitat Automation
emerging_technologies.description: Automated systems for constructing, maintaining, and managing habitats on other planets or space stations.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Facilitates long-term human habitation in space; reduces need for human presence in early stages of colonization.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Reliance on successful Mars missions, advancements in autonomous technology, and the need for sustainable space living.

mainstream_technologies.name: Level 5 Autonomous Vehicles
mainstream_technologies.description: Fully autonomous vehicles capable of handling all driving scenarios without human intervention.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread adoption in urban environments, regulatory frameworks in place, public trust increasing.

mainstream_technologies.name: Blockchain-based Digital Identity
mainstream_technologies.description: Secure, decentralized digital identity systems using blockchain for identity verification and data privacy.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Integrated into government and private sector services, providing secure identity management.

epoch_themes.description: An era where automation permeates every aspect of human life, from software development to space colonization.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Shift in job markets towards oversight and management of automated systems; increased efficiency and productivity; ethical considerations regarding AI and automation.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased focus on education for automation management, regulatory frameworks for AI and autonomous systems, international cooperation in space exploration.

epoch_themes.description: Advancements in technology that directly enhance human cognitive and physical capabilities.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Potential for societal stratification based on access to enhancement technologies; ethical debates on the nature of humanity and equality.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Ethical guidelines for human enhancement, research into the long-term effects, and international policies on cognitive rights.
